author: Anonymous Mouse
title: I can't run my program. What does this mean?
question:
Language: Beginning Student with List Abbreviations; memory limit: 256 MB.
. Interactions disabled; out of memory
instructor_answer: @309 has a similar issue, FYI. It's likely you have an infinite loop. Notice that, if something's wrong with the recursive call in a recursive function, your function will just keep going in circles forever (or, in practice, until DrRacket hits the memory limit); make sure your recursive call is always working with a smaller "amount" of data each time. Hope this helps!
